TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit TemplateColumn extends System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridColumn

Docs.summary: Represents a column type for the control that allows you to customize the layout of controls in the column.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TemplateColumn> column type in a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGrid> control to create a column with a customized control layout. You can provide a custom appearance for the heading section, the footer section, and the items section of the column by using the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TemplateColumn.HeaderTemplate%2A>, <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TemplateColumn.FooterTemplate%2A>, and <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TemplateColumn.ItemTemplate%2A> properties, respectively. You can also control how an item being edited is displayed in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TemplateColumn> object by setting the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TemplateColumn.EditItemTemplate%2A> property.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TemplateColumn> class to create a column in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGrid> control with a custom layout.
[!code-aspx-csharp[TemplateColumnEdit#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/TemplateColumnEdit/CS/templatecolumncs.aspx#1)] [!code-aspx-vb[TemplateColumnEdit#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/TemplateColumnEdit/VB/templatecolumnvb.aspx#1)]

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the template for displaying the item selected for editing in a object.
Docs.value: A -implemented object that contains the template for displaying the item being edited in the . The default value is , which indicates that this property is not set.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TemplateColumn.EditItemTemplate%2A> property to control the appearance of the item selected for editing in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TemplateColumn> object. The appearance is specified by creating a template that defines how the item is rendered in the column. To specify a template for the item selected for editing, first place opening and closing `<EditItemTemplate>` tags between the opening and closing tags of the `<TemplateColumn>` element. You can then list the content that controls the appearance of the item between the opening and closing `<EditItemTemplate>` tags. The content can be as simple as plain text, or it can be made more complex by embedding other controls in the template.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TemplateColumn.EditItemTemplate%2A> property to control the appearance of the item being edited in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TemplateColumn> object.
[!code-aspx-csharp[TemplateColumnEdit#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/TemplateColumnEdit/CS/templatecolumncs.aspx#1)] [!code-aspx-vb[TemplateColumnEdit#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/TemplateColumnEdit/VB/templatecolumnvb.aspx#1)]

The content can be as simple as plain text, or can be made more complex by embedding other controls in the template.
